Package edu.msoe.swe2721.lab14

Class Triangle

java.lang.Object
edu.msoe.swe2721.lab14.Triangle
public class Triangle extends Object
This class will hold information about a triangle, or at least a 3 sided object that could be a triangle.

  • Field Details

    • a

      private double a
      These represent the three sides of the triangle.

    • c

      private double c
      These represent the three sides of the triangle.

  • Constructor Details

    • Triangle

      public Triangle(double a, double b, double c) throws TriangleConstructionException
      This method will conmstruct a new instance of a Triangle baseed upon the sides.
      Parameters:
      a - This is side a length. Must be greater than 0.
      b - This is side b length. Must be greater than 0.
      c - This is side c length. Must be greater than 0.
      Throws:
      TriangleConstructionException - This exception will be thrown if any side is invalid.

  • Method Details

    • determineIfValid

      public boolean determineIfValid()
      This method will determine, based upon the sides, whether the triangle is valid.
      Returns:
      true if the triangle is valid from a definition of sides standpoint. False if it is not valid.

    • determineTriangleType

      public TriangleType determineTriangleType()
      This method will determine the triangle type based on sides a, b, and c.
      Returns:
      TriangleType.INVALID if invalid or TriangleType.EQUILATERAL, TriangleType.ISOSCELES, or TriangleType.SCALENE;

    • calculatePerimeter

      public double calculatePerimeter()
      This method will calculate the perimeter of the triangle.
      Returns:
      The return will be 0 if the triangle is not valid or the sum of the three sides if it is valid.

    • calculateArea

      public double calculateArea()
      This method will calculate the area of the triangle using Heron's formula, assuming the triangle is valid.
      Returns:
      The return value will be the area of the triangle, if valid, or 0 if the triangle is not valid. The result should be accurate to at least the nearest 0.0001.

    • obtainTextualRepresentation

      public String obtainTextualRepresentation()
      This method will return a textual representation for the triangle.
      Returns:
      A string representing the triangle. For example a=4.000 b=5.000 c=6.000 area=9.922 SCALENE
